com.defano.jmonet.canvas

Interface PaintCanvas

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CompositeSurface, ObservableSurface, ScalableLayeredPainting, Scrollable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPaintCanvas, JMonetCanvas

    public interface PaintCanvas
extends ScalableLayeredPainting, Scrollable, ObservableSurface, CompositeSurface
    A canvas that can be painted upon by the paint tools.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCanvasCommitObserver(CanvasCommitObserver observer)
      Adds an observer to be notified of scratch buffer commits.
      void clearCanvas()
      Clears the canvas by filling the scratch buffer with all white pixels, and then committing this change with a DST_OUT composite mode.
      void clearScratch()
      Creates a clean scratch buffer (replacing all pixels in the graphics context with transparent pixels).
      void commit()
      Commits the contents of the scratch buffer to the canvas, using the AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER composite mode.
      void commit(ChangeSet changeSet)
      Commits the given ChangeSet to the canvas.
      Rectangle getBounds()
      Gets the bounds of the canvas component.
      BufferedImage getCanvasImage()
      Gets the image represented by this drawable; not including any ephemeral changes that have been made--but not committed--to the canvas.
      Cursor getCursor()
      Gets the mouse cursor that is displayed when the mouse is within the bounds of this component.
      io.reactivex.Observable<Integer> getGridSpacingObservable()
      Gets an observable grid spacing property.
      io.reactivex.Observable<Double> getScaleObservable()
      Gets an observable scale factor.
      BufferedImage getScratchImage()
      Gets the "scratch" image associated with this drawable.
      void invalidateCanvas()
      Causes the Swing framework to redraw/refresh the canvas by calling Component.repaint().
      boolean isVisible()
      Determines if the canvas is visible.
      boolean removeCanvasCommitObserver(CanvasCommitObserver observer)
      Removes an existing observer.
      void setCursor(Cursor cursor)
      Sets the mouse cursor that is displayed when the mouse is within the bounds of this component.
      void setGridSpacing(int grid)
      Sets a grid spacing on which the mouse coordinates provided to the paint tools will be "snapped to".
      void setScale(double scale)
      Sets the scale factor of the canvas.
      void setScratchImage(BufferedImage image)
      Sets the contents of the scratch buffer to the provided image.
      void setSize(int width, int height)
      Sets the size of the canvas component (i.e., the size of the paintable image not including any scale).
      void setVisible(boolean visible)
      Sets whether the canvas is visible.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface.ScalableLayeredPainting

        convertPointToImage, getPaintLayers, getScale

      • Methods inherited from interface com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface.Scrollable

        setScrollPosition, updateScroll

      • Methods inherited from interface com.defano.jmonet.canvas.observable.ObservableSurface

        addSurfaceInteractionObserver, removeSurfaceInteractionObserver

      • Methods inherited from interface com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface.CompositeSurface

        addComponent, removeComponent

    • Method Detail

      • setVisible

        void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets whether the canvas is visible. When invisible, the component hierarchy will be drawn as though this component does not exist.
        Parameters:
        visible - True to make this canvas invisible; false for visible.

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Determines if the canvas is visible.
        Returns:
        True if visible; false otherwise.

      • setCursor

        void setCursor(Cursor cursor)
        Sets the mouse cursor that is displayed when the mouse is within the bounds of this component.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The active cursor to display

      • getCursor

        Cursor getCursor()
        Gets the mouse cursor that is displayed when the mouse is within the bounds of this component.
        Returns:
        The active cursor

      • addCanvasCommitObserver

        void addCanvasCommitObserver(CanvasCommitObserver observer)
        Adds an observer to be notified of scratch buffer commits.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer to be registered.

      • removeCanvasCommitObserver

        boolean removeCanvasCommitObserver(CanvasCommitObserver observer)
        Removes an existing observer.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer to be removed.
        Returns:
        True if the given observer was successfully unregistered; false otherwise.

      • invalidateCanvas

        void invalidateCanvas()
        Causes the Swing framework to redraw/refresh the canvas by calling Component.repaint().

      • commit

        void commit()
        Commits the contents of the scratch buffer to the canvas, using the AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER composite mode.

      • commit

        void commit(ChangeSet changeSet)
        Commits the given ChangeSet to the canvas.
        Parameters:
        changeSet - The ChangeSet to be committed.

      • setScale

        void setScale(double scale)
        Sets the scale factor of the canvas. Values greater than 1 result in the canvas image appearing enlarged; values less than 1 result in the canvas image appearing shrunken.
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale factor

      • getScaleObservable

        io.reactivex.Observable<Double> getScaleObservable()
        Gets an observable scale factor.
        Returns:
        The scale factor BehaviorSubject

      • setGridSpacing

        void setGridSpacing(int grid)
        Sets a grid spacing on which the mouse coordinates provided to the paint tools will be "snapped to".
        Parameters:
        grid - The grid spacing

      • getGridSpacingObservable

        io.reactivex.Observable<Integer> getGridSpacingObservable()
        Gets an observable grid spacing property.
        Returns:
        The grid spacing BehaviorSubject

      • setScratchImage

        void setScratchImage(BufferedImage image)
        Sets the contents of the scratch buffer to the provided image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image that should replace the contents of the current scratch buffer.

      • clearScratch

        void clearScratch()
        Creates a clean scratch buffer (replacing all pixels in the graphics context with transparent pixels).

      • clearCanvas

        void clearCanvas()
        Clears the canvas by filling the scratch buffer with all white pixels, and then committing this change with a DST_OUT composite mode.

      • getScratchImage

        BufferedImage getScratchImage()
        Gets the "scratch" image associated with this drawable. The "scratch" image is a temporary buffer allowing tools to draw on the canvas in a way that doesn't affect the underlying graphic.
        Returns:
        The scratch buffer image.

      • getCanvasImage

        BufferedImage getCanvasImage()
        Gets the image represented by this drawable; not including any ephemeral changes that have been made--but not committed--to the canvas.
        Returns:
        The canvas image.

      • setSize

        void setSize(int width,
             int height)
        Sets the size of the canvas component (i.e., the size of the paintable image not including any scale). As such, the size of the canvas will not match necessarily match the size of the image returned by getCanvasImage() when the scale factor is a value other than 1.0.
        Parameters:
        width - The desired width of the paintable image
        height - The desired height of the paintable image

      • getBounds

        Rectangle getBounds()
        Gets the bounds of the canvas component. This value will not necessarily match the size of the paintable image when a scale factor other than 1.0 has been applied.
        Returns:
        The bounds of the canvas component.
